definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: He is the boss's favourite because he is a yesman.
sentences.chinese: 他是老闆的寵愛，因爲他是應聲蟲。

sentences.english: The students feared any siblings would steal their parents exclusive love, Wang said.

sentences.english: Here are some simple things you can do to pamper your peepers.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有一些簡單的事情你可以做你的同輩人寵愛。

sentences.english: Deng Tong is Han Wendi is male bestow favor on, article emperor dotes on to him extremely.

sentences.english: The lap-dog knew many tricks, and was a great favourite with his master.
sentences.chinese: 哈巴狗卻會很多的鬼把戲，深得主人的寵愛。

sentences.english: More and more people have Canada to its love.
sentences.chinese: 越來越多的人對其寵愛有加。

sentences.english: When his youngest son, whom he loved most defied him, his face turned purple with anger.
sentences.chinese: 當他最寵愛的小兒子公然反抗他時，他氣得臉色發青。

sentences.english: She has a weakness for puppy.
BRITAIN'S pensioners are a cosseted lot.
sentences.chinese: 英國的退休老人可謂是集萬千寵愛於一身。

sentences.english: Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May.
sentences.chinese: 狂風把五月寵愛的嫩蕊作踐。

sentences.english: Who said to me, all the thousands of pet me.
sentences.chinese: 線誰會對我說，萬千寵愛全給我。

sentences.english: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain.
sentences.chinese: 寵愛是欺詐的，美麗是空虛的。

sentences.english: The month of vegetable is certainly thus hard to plague because the doter of the big young master.
